page.title: 16Police in Brookmans Park
page.content: We have our own village policeman, who rides around the area on his bicycle. He often comes into school and this term he has been giving talks to the fourth year juniors on the work of the police force. Everybody knows him. He helps to run the Youth Centre and takes part in any pantomimes or musicals that are put on in the village. As there are many expensive houses in the village they are all fitted with burglar alarms but there are still many robberies. In June 1985 a petrol filling station on the A1000 was robbed and the attendant was driven away as a hostage. Two months earlier a newsagent was robbed by two youths who escaped in a car. The policeman asks people to keep an eye on each other's houses. This is the local neighbourly watch campaign.
